intro: Eugenia stipularis, commonly known as the black mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the coastal regions of the Americas, particularly in tropical and subtropical areas. The plant is characterized by its dark, almost black bark and its ability to thrive in saline environments. Its leaves are opposite,革质 (leathery), and often have a distinctive stipular structure. The small, white flowers produce small, fleshy fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife species.
